channel.title: CVE Feed for zephyrproject-rtos -- Zephyr
channel.description: The latest CVEs for zephyrproject-rtos -- Zephyr

item.title: CVE-2023-0359|2024-08-02T05:10:55.636Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: A missing nullptr-check in handle_ra_input can cause a nullptr-deref.

item.title: CVE-2023-1901|2024-08-02T06:05:26.711Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: The bluetooth HCI host layer logic not clearing a global reference to a semaphore after synchronously sending HCI commands may allow a malicious HCI Controller to cause the use of a dangling reference in the host layer, leading to a crash (DoS) or potential RCE on the Host layer.

item.title: CVE-2023-0396|2024-08-02T05:10:55.614Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: A malicious / defective bluetooth controller can cause buffer overreads in the most functions that process HCI command responses.

item.title: CVE-2023-1902|2024-08-02T06:05:26.909Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: The bluetooth HCI host layer logic not clearing a global reference to a state pointer after handling connection events may allow a malicious HCI Controller to cause the use of a dangling reference in the host layer, leading to a crash (DoS) or potential RCE on the Host layer.

item.title: CVE-2023-0397|2024-08-02T05:10:55.717Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: A malicious / defect bluetooth controller can cause a Denial of Service due to unchecked input in le_read_buffer_size_complete.

item.title: CVE-2023-3725|2024-08-02T07:01:57.377Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Potential buffer overflow vulnerability in the Zephyr CAN bus subsystem

item.title: CVE-2023-0779|2024-08-02T05:24:34.381Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: At the most basic level, an invalid pointer can be input that crashes the device, but with more knowledge of the deviceâ€™s memory layout, further exploitation is possible.

item.title: CVE-2023-2234|2024-08-02T06:19:13.607Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Union variant confusion allows any malicious BT controller to execute arbitrary code on the Zephyr host.

item.title: CVE-2024-3332|2024-08-01T20:05:08.484Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: A malicious BLE device can send a specific order of packet sequence to cause a DoS attack on the victim BLE device

item.title: CVE-2024-1638|2024-08-01T18:48:21.828Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: The documentation specifies that the BT_GATT_PERM_READ_LESC and BT_GATT_PERM_WRITE_LESC defines for a Bluetooth characteristic: Attribute read/write permission with LE Secure Connection encryption. If set, requires that LE Secure Connections is used for read/write access, however this is only true when it is combined with other permissions, namely BT_GATT_PERM_READ_ENCRYPT/BT_GATT_PERM_READ_AUTHEN (for read) or BT_GATT_PERM_WRITE_ENCRYPT/BT_GATT_PERM_WRITE_AUTHEN (for write), if these additional permissions are not set (even in secure connections only mode) then the stack does not perform any permission checks on these characteristics and they can be freely written/read.

item.title: CVE-2023-6749|2024-07-26T15:24:08.412Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Unchecked length coming from user input in settings shell

item.title: CVE-2024-3332|2024-07-03T18:00:13.536Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: A malicious BLE device can send a specific order of packet sequence to cause a DoS attack on the victim BLE device

item.title: CVE-2023-5779|2024-02-18T07:46:41.927Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: can: out of bounds in remove_rx_filter function

item.title: CVE-2023-7060|2024-06-04T17:17:29.040Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Zephyr OS IP packet handling does not properly drop IP packets arriving on an external interface with a source address equal to 127.0.01 or the destination address.

item.title: CVE-2023-6749|2024-02-18T07:04:36.321Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Unchecked length coming from user input in settings shell

item.title: CVE-2023-6249|2024-02-18T07:27:13.399Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Signed to unsigned conversion esp32_ipm_send

item.title: CVE-2023-6881|2024-06-04T17:17:04.296Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Possible buffer overflow in is_mount_point

item.title: CVE-2024-1638|2024-02-19T21:19:51.915Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: The documentation specifies that the BT_GATT_PERM_READ_LESC and BT_GATT_PERM_WRITE_LESC defines for a Bluetooth characteristic: Attribute read/write permission with LE Secure Connection encryption. If set, requires that LE Secure Connections is used for read/write access, however this is only true when it is combined with other permissions, namely BT_GATT_PERM_READ_ENCRYPT/BT_GATT_PERM_READ_AUTHEN (for read) or BT_GATT_PERM_WRITE_ENCRYPT/BT_GATT_PERM_WRITE_AUTHEN (for write), if these additional permissions are not set (even in secure connections only mode) then the stack does not perform any permission checks on these characteristics and they can be freely written/read.

item.title: CVE-2024-3077|2024-06-04T17:31:38.524Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: An malicious BLE device can crash BLE victim device by sending malformed gatt packet

item.title: CVE-2024-3332|2024-07-03T16:44:28.197Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: A malicious BLE device can send a specific order of packet sequence to cause a DoS attack on the victim BLE device

item.title: CVE-2023-6249|2024-07-05T17:20:57.320Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: Signed to unsigned conversion esp32_ipm_send

item.title: CVE-2024-1638|2024-07-29T15:19:42.376Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: The documentation specifies that the BT_GATT_PERM_READ_LESC and BT_GATT_PERM_WRITE_LESC defines for a Bluetooth characteristic: Attribute read/write permission with LE Secure Connection encryption. If set, requires that LE Secure Connections is used for read/write access, however this is only true when it is combined with other permissions, namely BT_GATT_PERM_READ_ENCRYPT/BT_GATT_PERM_READ_AUTHEN (for read) or BT_GATT_PERM_WRITE_ENCRYPT/BT_GATT_PERM_WRITE_AUTHEN (for write), if these additional permissions are not set (even in secure connections only mode) then the stack does not perform any permission checks on these characteristics and they can be freely written/read.

item.title: CVE-2024-3077|2024-08-01T19:32:42.668Z -- zephyrproject-rtos -- zephyr
item.description: An malicious BLE device can crash BLE victim device by sending malformed gatt packet
